definition: to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment

sentences.english: He went out one night to play cards with his friends when his wife was asleep.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，当他妻子睡觉时，他出去和他的朋友玩牌。

sentences.english: Or having friends over to play cards?
sentences.chinese: 或者通过玩牌认识朋友呢？

sentences.english: We ate moon cakes, played cards, and listened to romantic poems recited by one of our classmates.
sentences.chinese: 我们吃月饼，玩牌，听我们班同学的浪漫诗朗诵。

sentences.english: It was while playing poker at the Amsterdam casino that I met Greg.
sentences.chinese: 在阿姆斯特丹的赌场里玩牌时，我认识了格雷格。

sentences.english: After eating a meal, master guest plays a card, young nurse is cleared away think breakfast rests.
sentences.chinese: 吃完饭后，主人客人玩牌，小保姆收拾完想早点休息。

sentences.english: Wednesday used to be your day for playing cards with Martin.
sentences.chinese: 星期三通常是你跟马丁玩牌的日子。

sentences.english: XiaoMin mother continuously like playing CARDS, owes a lot of betting debts.
sentences.chinese: 小敏的妈妈不断喜欢玩牌赌钱，欠下了不少债。

sentences.english: He never stopped kibitzing when we played cards.
sentences.chinese: 在我们玩牌时他一直乱出主意，多嘴多舌。

sentences.english: John sat down with him in private to cards and pigeoned him.
sentences.chinese: 约翰和他私下坐下来玩牌，并诈骗他。

sentences.english: You would see people playing cards and flying kites.
sentences.chinese: “你会看到很多人在玩牌和放风筝”。

sentences.english: I used to play with him a lot.
sentences.chinese: 我那会儿常和他一起玩牌。

sentences.english: We generally play Mah-jong or cards together while chatting at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 我们一般一边聊天一边打麻将或玩牌什么的。

sentences.english: In earlier days, the church proscribed dancing and card playing.
sentences.chinese: 从前，教会禁止舞蹈和玩牌。

definition: gambling get-together/game of cards, mahjong etc
pai gow (gambling game played with dominoes)
to draw a tile (at mahjong)/to play mahjong
